entry.title: How to Access Custom Widget Event Payload (onMapClick) in SAC Analytic Applications
entry.content:
Hello Experts,
I am developing a custom widget in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) using the ArcGIS JavaScript API.
In the widget manifest (GeoMap.json), I defined a custom event onMapClick.
In the component (component.js), I dispatch the event with payload:
this.dispatchEvent(
new CustomEvent("onMapClick", {
detail: { lat, lon, radiusKm }
})
);
After connecting the configuration file and re-importing, the onMapClick event is visible in the Analytic Application events panel, and I can attach an event handler.
Issue:
Inside the SAC scripting environment, I cannot access the event payload.
Neither event nor thisEvent variables are recognized.
When I try event.detail.lat or event.detail.lon, I get “unknown variable” errors.
Expectation:
I want to consume the event payload (lat/lon/radiusKm) in my SAC application script when the event is triggered.
Question:
How can I correctly access the payload of a custom widget event in SAC scripting?
Is there a specific way SAC passes event.detail into the scripting editor?
Any guidance or example would be really helpful.

entry.title: Why SAP BTP Is the Architect’s New Canvas
entry.content:
Introduction

In the evolving world of enterprise IT, solution architects need a development platform that balances agility with structural integrity and SAP BTP delivers just that. It’s not merely a technology stack but it's a canvas where business intent meets technical artistry.

1. BTP Through the Architect’s Lens

SAP BTP combines application development, data & analytics, integration, and AI/automation into one cohesive platform. For example, you can build a microservice in CAP that pushes real-time sales data to a dashboard in SAC using Integration Suite without touching the core S/4HANA code. This helps avoid messy customizations and keeps your architecture clean.

2. Why It Matters for the Business

Using BTP isn’t just about technology but it’s about delivering results faster. Your stakeholders get real-time insights, automated processes, and new capabilities without waiting months for custom S/4HANA changes. BTP helps you stay agile while keeping systems secure and compliant.

3. The Core Pillars You Should Master

As an architect, you should be comfortable with four main areas:

  • Development & Automation: Decide when to use CAP, RAP, or low-code tools like SAP Build Apps depending on business needs and governance.
  • Data & Analytics: Use SAP Analytics Cloud and Datasphere to converge enterprise-wide insights with ease.
  • Integration: Integration Suite delivers APIs, workflows, Event Mesh just plug the right adapter and connect systems seamlessly.
  • Intelligence & Automation: AI services and automation close the loop from predictive insights to autonomous decision-handling

4. Why Architects Should Focus Here

  • Clean Core Strategy: Push extensions into BTP, not into S/4HANA (SAP’s clean-core philosophy).
  • Future-Proof Integrations: Use API-led patterns and composable services to stay nimble.
  • One Platform, Many Scenarios: Your SAC, CAP apps, workflows, and APIs can all live on BTP. This streamlines operations and ensures governance.
  • Pattern Reusability: Build integrations and dashboards once, and reuse them across multiple scenarios.

5. A Real-World Glimpse

Consider a manufacturing enterprise needing real-time sales dashboards. Architecting on BTP means:

Real-Time Integration: Use Integration Suite to funnel S/4HANA data through Event Mesh.

Clean Extensions: Enrich sales logic using CAP-based microservices.

Visualization: Deliver dashboards via SAP Analytics Cloud.

Governance: All components live under a unified BTP administration umbrella.

No messy SAP wrappers, no brittle custom code, just elegant, maintainable architecture.

 

Conclusion

For today’s architect, SAP BTP is less of a toolset and more of a design philosophy, a way to tie business strategy, integration, data, and intelligence into one disciplined, scalable platform. It’s a way to work smarter as an architect. Master it once, and you’re not just configuring systems, but you are shaping the future of your company’s SAP landscape.

#SAPBTP
#SAPSolutionArchitect
#SAPIntegration
#SAPAnalyticsCloud
#CleanCore

entry.title: Integrated Financial Planning OPEX Cost Rates Data Action
entry.content:
Hey All, 

 

Could anyone help me understand a part of the standard IFP content?
In the Cost Center Activity Cost Rate Calculation, under the Cost Rate section, there is a data action called “Calculate CCtr Activity Cost Rates with Account-Based Split”.

Within its code, I came across the following line, and I’m unsure of its purpose. When I try debugging, it shows empty values:

DATA([d/Measures] = #M2, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT].[p/ALLOCATION_ACCOUNT]) = RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #M1)

 

FOR @Counter = 1 TO 100
IF [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_COSTCENTER] != "#" THEN
// Reset #COST for next iteration
DATA([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = #COST, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_CODEBITCREDITCODE] = "D", [d/Date] = #T1) * 0

entry.title: SAC VBA add-in - getting stuck on Sign in and Sign out function; macro freezing
entry.content:
Hi team,

We have recently started using the SAC VBA add-in to automate some of our excel reports (ref: https://me.sap.com/notes/3594453). I am experiencing an issue where the macro will freeze at the sign in or sign out function.

In one instance, the macro will sign in to SAC, refresh a table and then attempt to sign out again. However, the macro is freezing at the sign out function. Unfortunately, I haven't been able to find a work around for this issue. 

In another instance, if the user has already signed into SAC either in that particular workbook or in another workbook that is open on their desktop, when the macro attempts to sign in, it will freeze. 

Has anyone else experienced either of these problems? How have you resolved it? We are all working on WindowsOS.

Thanks

entry.title: How can the filters of story hyperlinks inserted through text boxes be customized and controlled？
entry.content:
Dear,

when using SAC Stories - Creating Responsive Pages, I encountered such a business scenario requirement and hope to seek technical solutions or functional support.

Problem description:

Currently, we insert text into the responsive page and link to another Story through the "hyperlink" in the text box. The Story opened by the user through this hyperlink will inherit the default filter values of the form itself (for example, the time filter will display "All Times" by default). However, our business requirement is that when users jump through hyperlinks, the filters of the target Story (such as the time filter) can be automatically set to specific values (for example, only checking "2025") to save users the manual filtering operation steps.

Demand Scenario

1. Current behavior: After the hyperlink jumps, the filters of the target Story use their preset default values (for example, the time filter displays "All Times").

2. Expected behavior: Dynamically control the default values of the filters for the target Story through hyperlink parameters in the responsive page (for example, only select "2025" for the time filter).

Is there a solution? Thank you for your support!

The relevant screenshots are attached.

Does anyone know how to enable sorting for a table in compact display mode?

Many thanks in advance for your help!

Best regards

entry.title: SAC Table - Measures disappear after setting dimension filter even though there is data
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

in SAC I have a table with the dimension "Company" in rows as well as the date and multiple measures in the columns.

Without any filters applied you can see that there is data for all measures for one company. However, when I set a filter on this Company (either via Story filter or filter inside the chart) all the measures disappear from the table. See screenshots attached.

I would expect the one row to be displayed with the measures. It works in other tables, just not this one.

Info:

  • I set all zeros and nulls to be shown in the table settings.
  • The source of the data model is Datasphere. When I preview the data there, I can see the measures for this company and can set a filter

Thank you for your help!

Regards

Maike

entry.title: Story variable not restricting data by category in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Community,

I am facing an issue with variables in story in SAP Analytics Cloud. I am also a beginner here. I created a variable in the model (cat_tech) on the Category.ID dimension, with default value = Technology.

In the story, I also selected the variable and even get the input prompt when the story loads. However, even after choosing a value (e.g., Technology or Fitness), the table in my story still shows all categories instead of being restricted to the selected one.

Steps I followed,

  • Created the variable in the model (cat_tech → bound to Category.ID).

  • Set a default value (Technology).

  • In the story, I confirmed the variable prompt appears and I can select a different value.

  • After setting it, the dataset in the story still displays all categories (Technology, Food, Gaming, Travel, Fitness), instead of restricting to the chosen one.

I have attached screenshots. Of course, this is from a dummy dataset. I am also having problem with SAP BW dataset.

❓Am I missing something?

In ModelerIn Story

Thanks a lot for any guidance!

entry.title: SAC – How to validate user-typed input in a Dropdown widget (not selected from list)?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I am working in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) Planning mode and I have a Dropdown widget. Normally, users select values from the list, and I can get the key using Dropdown.getSelectedKey(). This Dropdown list's items are added by a fixed array of string on initialization, without default value.

However, I noticed that users can also type a value directly into the dropdown without choosing from the list. In this case:

  • Dropdown.getSelectedKey() returns nothing.

  • I cannot find a way to capture the typed input.

  • I want to check if the typed value exists in the dropdown list.

  • If it’s not valid, I would like to either show a warning message or clear the input.

My questions:

  1. How can I get the user’s typed input value (not just the selected key)?

  2. Is there a best practice in SAC to validate custom input against the dropdown list?

  3. Or if l can disable free text in a Dropdown widget?

Thanks for any help!

Iksuuu

@N1kh1l

entry.title: Shifting Table Data Based on Parameter Value
entry.content:
Hello team!
I have this table, and I want the data to shift forward based on the value I define in a parameter. For example, if I set the parameter to 2, all the data in the table should move forward by 2 months, and the first 2 months should be set to 0.
Is it possible to do this?

I tried using this code. It shifts the months according to the value I set in the parameter, but then it sets everything to 0:

 

DATA(
[d/Measures] = "Valor",
[d/Date] = NEXT(%PMR%, "MONTH")
) = RESULTLOOKUP(
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
)
 
DATA(
[d/Date] = PREVIOUS(%PMR%,"MONTH",[d/Date]),
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
) = 0

entry.title: SAC Story Filter API | On Change Event
entry.content:
Dear all,

I am currently working on a SAC story that consumes a BW query via live connection. The query is designed to rely solely on story filters and variables from the BW live model.

However, we’ve encountered a strange issue with a time variable. When opening the story and providing an initial input value, everything works as expected. But if we change the prompt while the story is already open, the numbers do not update. The only way to reflect the new values is by refreshing the page and restarting the story—this allows us to enter a new input value, and then the correct data is displayed.

 

In summary, changing the prompt within the story has no impact on the on-the-fly calculations. It appears that no request is sent to BW unless the story is reloaded with the desired variable value.

Has anyone experienced something similar?

My proposed solution was to capture the click on the story or variable filter, track the change, and then trigger a story refresh. However, this approach is problematic since story filters do not support an onChange event. Reopening the story every time the timestamp needs to be changed is not a user-friendly solution.

Do you have any alternative ideas or workarounds to address this issue?

Best regards,

entry.title: Histroy crashing after model replacement
entry.content:
Hello,

We are having this issue with a history in SAP Analytics Cloud, i will describe it in bullets for better understanding:

  1. We developed a analytic model in sap datasphere in a space called QA
  2. Then we made a history in SAP Analytics Cloud that consumes that analytic model in QA, everything is working correctly.
  3. We made a package of the analytic model in QA and imported it into another space called PRD
  4. Then we try replacing the model of the SAP Analytics Cloud history from the model in the space QA to the new model in the space PRD, but when we do this, we get this error:

    And everything crashes, nothing loads, and the web jus collapse.

  5. We tried making a fresh history with nothing in it and consuming the new model in the space PRD and that works fine

  6.  We tried making a fresh history with nothing in it and consuming the new model in the space QA and then replace it with the PRD model and that worked fine too.

  7. We also try erasing the analytic model in prd and all its pipeline, and then make a fresh package and import it again, but it doesn't work.

Thank in advance for your suggestions.

entry.title: Blended model in a story: type of link
entry.content:
Hi expert

I'm struggling with a blended models in an story ( Chart widget) 

In one Chart widget  I have linked two model

One is the primary ( Sales ) and another is the secondary ( Costs) 

They are linked with Material object . 

All materials not in secondary model are skipped also in the first.

 

Type of link is: "all primary data"

Some materials ( tipically service, labor ..) are in primary model ( they are sold) but not in the secondary.

My expetation it was that with this type of link is like "left outher join" (Sql)  but seems not the same things.

All materials not in secondary are skipped from primary also.

 

What am I doing wrong ?
